snippet: An appeals court convincingly ruled that an inmate could sue the warden for endangering his health and for cruel and unusual punishment when the heat index in his unit reached “extreme danger.”
abstract: Editorial expresses support for inmate Eugene Blackmon's suit against a state prison in Beeville, Tex, accusing prison officials of doing little to relieve him and his fellow prisoners during 130-degree weather in the summer of 2008.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court convincingly ruled that an inmate could sue the warden for endangering his health and for cruel and unusual punishment when the heat index in his unit reached “extreme danger.”
